title: How to Draw Bellum from Zelda

steps.headline: Start with the basic shapes that compose the body.
steps.description: Draw a circle for the head, connected to two large ovals so you end up with a shape like a very round cake.

steps.headline: Draw rectangles, three at the front and two at the back.
steps.description: This is where the tentacles begin, so make these bases as solid as possible.

steps.headline: Sketch the tail.
steps.description: It should look something like that of a crayfish. Draw diamond shapes that are connected to one other via a line. Draw the tip by sticking three triangles together.

steps.headline: Draw lines for the tentacles.
steps.description: At the tip of each, draw an oval. Draw concentric circles inside each tip to create the eyes.

steps.headline: Draw Bellum's "head".
steps.description: Remember that Bellum's head is actually a mouth with spiky teeth. Don't forget the lips and to show the teeth.

steps.headline: Sketch in the pattern on his body as shown.
steps.description: Use leaf shapes and swirls on the upper portion, then dots and dashes on the bottom for the most effective look.

steps.headline: Outline and color in your entire drawing.
steps.description: Add shadows and highlights to add more depth to your illustration and you are done!

text: Start with the basic shapes that compose the body. Draw a circle for the head, connected to two large ovals so you end up with a shape like a very round cake. Draw rectangles, three at the front and two at the back. This is where the tentacles begin, so make these bases as solid as possible. Sketch the tail. It should look something like that of a crayfish. Draw diamond shapes that are connected to one other via a line. Draw the tip by sticking three triangles together. Draw lines for the tentacles. At the tip of each, draw an oval. Draw concentric circles inside each tip to create the eyes. Draw Bellum's "head". Remember that Bellum's head is actually a mouth with spiky teeth. Don't forget the lips and to show the teeth. Sketch in the pattern on his body as shown. Use leaf shapes and swirls on the upper portion, then dots and dashes on the bottom for the most effective look. Outline and color in your entire drawing. Add shadows and highlights to add more depth to your illustration and you are done!
